subtasks: Analyze form and structure of cherry trees.
Thin out dense growth to improve sunlight penetration.
Remove dead, diseased, or injured branches from peach trees.
Thin cranberry arm overhanging the fence.
Prune grapevines by cutting spurs to one or two buds.
Distinguish between summer and winter pruning techniques.
Explain effects of winter pruning on tree growth and hormone balance.
Thin out lanky and vigorous shoots on apple trees for size control.
Highlight the importance of proper pruning for disease and pest management.
Demonstrate proper spacing and layering in espalier trees.
Trim excess branches to maintain tree form and prevent shading.

tasks.task: Pruning stone fruits for fruiting bud development.
subtasks: Identify and preserve fruiting buds on apricot and plum trees.
Remove non-fruiting, lanky growth on plums for better fruit set.

tasks.task: Pruning stone fruits for fruiting bud development.**
